It's good.

Polarity system works cool and is used by enemy pattern and attacks to its fullest ([spoiler]it's better than Exceed's polarity system don't even tell me that it's not[/spoiler]).

Each boss increases in difficulty without relying on just shooting more stuff at you. They each give you a unique task to practise and accomplish.

Channging difficulty is interesting too as it introduces a retaliation system where killing an enemy on normal difficulty that is polarised the same to you will have it fire a bunch of bullets right at you on death in the same polarity. This means you have to manage your timing on killing enemies to be able to switch polarity easily without getting wrecked by the retaliation. ([spoiler]Retaliation happens with every hittekai death regardless of polarity on hard mode fucking hell it's insane lmao[/spoiler]).

38678317.review:
Max Chain, Max Chain, Max Cha-
1 Chain GOD FUCKING DAMNITTTTTT


On a more serious note, it's good as long as you don't mind endless practice. It's a shooter that's practically a puzzle game about timing and precise movement, that feels glorious to finally pull off. The feeling is almost like playing a piece of music, and it's fitting that the game's music is synced up to the automatically scrolling levels that govern the gameplay. 

Killing enemies quickly spawns new ones, which opens up new opportunities for you to score points. The more points you score, the more lives you have so you stand a chance at surviving the really tricky parts. And once you get really good at scoring, you obviously will be good enough at the game to not need all those extra lives. 

There's a sense of exhiliration and joy when you discover a new tactic to clear an area effectively or beat a boss quickly, and a driving energy that keeps you going forward even when you die over and over again. Each death makes you stronger. And even though I'm still a far way from 1CC, I can still see how far I've come and feel exhilirated.

[h1]Embrace Your Inner Autist[/h1]

Pro's:
+ Very responsive controls
+ Simple but tasteful graphics
+ Allows rotating your screen
+ Good music that syncs well with the level design
+ The Black-White chain system rewards boldness and skill

Con's:
- The UI is a bit messy, surely could've been made prettier

If you like shmups at all, this game is for you. It is a masterpiece of simplistic beauty.

But the game's difficulty will probably kick your butt, so don't play it without expecting to see the Game Over screen a few times.

38037493.review:
[h1]《斑鸠》：生如斑鸠[/h1]

到了地球的尽头问人们：“你们可明白了你们在地球上生活吗？你们怎样总结这一生的生活呢？”那时候人们就可以默默地递过《斑鸠》，说：[b]“这就是我给生活作的总结，我为了我的意志而活，为此付出过的我死而无憾。”[/b]
虽说这段话源自陀思妥耶夫斯基对塞万提斯的《堂吉诃德》的评论，不过因为一点点小私心，我也愿意这样形容《斑鸠》这部作品。作为世嘉Dreamcast主机名义上的最后一部游戏，它见证了世嘉在助剂行业的终结，同时见证了21世纪初新的游戏时代的开启。《斑鸠》作为STG游戏的异端，拥有着与众不同的游戏机制，以STG这个特殊的游戏形式讲述了一部史诗般的剧情，这也是十多年后这款游戏仍然被众多玩家推崇的原因。

所以在今天这个我一年只有一次的日子，我们谈一谈《斑鸠》这个游戏，讲一讲它背后的故事。

首先让我们提一下STG这类游戏，也就是俗称的“打飞机”游戏。这类游戏起源于上个世纪的街机游戏厅，以华丽的弹幕和变态的难度而知名。从上个世纪的彩京，再到这个时代做手游顺便做STG的CAVE都是著名的STG厂商。首领蜂、雷电、东方project这些游戏几乎玩家们已经耳熟能详了。STG作为知名度大，实际玩家却很少的游戏类型其实不无理由。老式的STG一向以弹幕地狱自居。敌机会千方百计地放出各种弹幕妄图击破我们的自机，对面看似温柔的小姐姐说不准一个非符就能把玩家射爆。所以玩家能做的一般都是按紧攻击键不放松，从关头一直杀到关尾，丝毫不能懈怠。                               
在上个世纪，玩家们接触的游戏少，而游戏的难度普遍偏高，那个时候的玩家普遍喜欢钻研，亦或是直接砸上几十几百个币打通一款游戏，也正是那个时代，STG才能风靡一时，触手们喜欢秀走位骚操作，围观群众们看个热闹图个新鲜，街机厅老板也有的赚头。这股势头直到家用机抢占客厅市场后仍未消退。但在现今这个时代，玩家的选择越来越多。而且因为快节奏的生活方式，玩家愿意钻研一个游戏的势头渐渐熄灭，于是玩家将重心放在了其他形式的游戏。而《斑鸠》这款游戏，恰恰就发布在新旧时代交替的21世纪。

而提到《斑鸠》，我们就不得不提及它的前作：《闪亮银枪》。《闪亮银枪》同样最初发布于街机游戏，后来移植到世嘉土星这款主机上，增加了剧情和过场动画。在当时的STG市场中，《闪银》可谓是一枝独秀。该作的流程缓慢但不失节奏感，但玩家控制的机体有七种攻击方式，玩家需要控制三个按键来操纵这七种攻击方式，用不同颜色的子弹和不同的攻击方式击落敌机。所以缓慢的游戏流程带来的是对玩家观察和规划能力的挑战，所以有玩家认为闪银再用STG的方式解谜。而该作的流程也达到了破天荒一个半小时的时间。对比一下东方，每一部东方的流程算上按正常的六面和EX关卡，也最多一个小时。这么长的游戏流程，自然要给玩家带来足够震撼的体验方能让玩家玩得进去。这就和游戏机制有关了。连续击破相同颜色的敌机达成连击可以获得高分和奖命。这样的机制使得游戏的节奏更加紧凑。掌握了这样的游戏机制带来的节奏感，轻度玩家能走好流程，重度玩家会钻研连击的技巧，达到更高的分数。该作的配乐由崎元仁制作，作曲精良，完全符合这种恰到好处的节奏感。游戏的剧情则为游戏体验带来的紧凑感锦上添花。STG一贯是重体验而轻剧情的游戏类型。就连东方这种拥有庞大世界观的STG，也依靠着大量的设定和同人支持整个世界观的构建，以至于让刚入坑的东方新人常常一脸懵逼。如此多的角色带来的不仅是入坑的困难，还有无法克服的角色同质化。新作天空璋角色缺乏新意也为人诟病。

《闪亮银枪》与常规STG大不相同。在初入游戏你会发现第一关的名字是3A，而不是1A或是Level 1这种司空见惯的标题。闪银大胆地运用了倒叙插叙的手法，讲述了一个有关人类的灭绝，命运的轮回的故事。这在STG史上也是头一遭。即使是没接触过这部作品的玩家，我也希望你们能找资料了解一下剧情。也正因为玩法的创新和剧本的革新，《闪亮银枪》被推到了艺术品的高度。

不过该没人玩还是没人玩就是了。

时隔数年，我们迎来了他的续作：《斑鸠》。

老实说让我搞一台Dreamcast去玩这款游戏，我也是做不到的。我是在Steam上购买的这款游戏的PC移植版。而这款游戏的移植质量也是相当优秀。PC版本不仅支持竖屏游戏，而且在键位上同样人性化。玩家既可以用常规的zx及方向键进行操作，也可以用wasd键位和鼠标操作。美中不足的是不支持街机手柄。不过普通玩家一般也没有街机手柄这种东西（笑）。何况本作在手柄上的体验也是极佳的。所以本人的主要体验也来自于PC版。   如果说《闪亮银枪》为STG的巨人的话，那么《斑鸠》就是站在了巨人的肩膀上，达到了STG游戏的新高度。本作的画面是全3D的，画风精良，即使是放到了十几年后的今天，在第一关开头斑鸠起飞的那一幕仍足以激动人心。在图像表现上，《斑鸠》做到了最好。从游戏中自带的设定Gallery，能看出《斑鸠》带有浓郁的日式风格，这使得本作在朦胧的气氛中带给玩家一丝凄凉和悲壮的情感。

在前作的基础上，本作的游戏机制变化不大，可玩性丝毫不减。算是一种变相的妥协吧，本作有相应的简化。本作只有黑白两种攻击方式，这正应了斑鸠这种鸟有黑白二色。玩家要变化自己集体的颜色发射相应颜色的子弹，敌机也会放出两色的弹幕，玩家的自机可以同性相吸，吸收相同颜色的子弹积攒能量槽，使出“力之解放”这样类似于bomb的招数。用异色的子弹对敌机有1.5倍伤害。连续击破三架颜色相同的敌机才能达成一次连击。连击越多，分数越高。在300万分时自己会有奖命，此后每500万分，玩家便能得到一次奖命。游戏流程也只有半个小时。但缩短的流程、简化的操作意味着更高强度的推版。但即使是在加快的节奏感下，玩家仍需要思考如何最大效率地击破敌机，所以背板是不可少的，高手推斑鸠也是十分赏心悦目的，国外有大神同时操纵2P通关，不可不谓之为神人。

本作的剧情架构简单明了。每一关的标题都对应了一个主题：理想，试炼，信念，现实，轮回。理想这关十分简单，代表了初生牛犊不怕虎的精神；试炼一关难度激增，代表历经重重磨难；信念这关难度略微降低，代表重新振作;但随之而来的就是现实的沉重打击。这一关相当于于boss从头打到尾，让人心头一震；最后在轮回时主角们拾起理想，决死一搏。

但我一直想说的是，[b]故事简单未必是件坏事[/b]。很多时候编剧啊作家啊总想建立一个庞大的架构支持整个故事，这样的剧情不鸣则已，一鸣惊人。但这样的水平并不是所有人都能达到的。《尼尔：机械生命》对于我来说就是个玩脱的例子。这让我想到最近贝塞斯达发售的两款大作《德军总部：新巨人》和《恶灵附身2》。德总的剧情一向是经典套路的美国大片风格，但却主旋律满满，能真切地感受到剧情带来的诚意。《恶灵附身2》的剧本不再由三上真司编写，因此本作的剧情没有了前代那般晦涩难懂。虽说捡垃圾顺便救女儿的梗从《寂静岭1》起就已经被玩坏了，但是在极恶之下却能展现人性的光明和纯粹的善良，这份三上一直坚持的价值是永不过时的。所以能把简单的剧情讲得好，反倒要下一番苦工。

《斑鸠》的理念也正基于此。无论是从标题，再到每关开头出现的话语段落，再到结局的对白，毫无疑问的是，《斑鸠》在用自己的方式讲述一部史诗。《斑鸠》将故事浓缩，以这些段落为载体让玩家思考，再通过弹幕的演出来渲染悲剧的效果，到了结局，玩家自然会明白这一切的付出是否值得。而官方也有关于斑鸠的文字，补充了所有故事的情节。这是一个为了自己意志而献身的故事，这是一部浓缩了人生的史诗。值得一提的是，闪银和斑鸠的最终boss都是The-Stone Like，名为产土神辉黄之块。在闪银中这个boss在不同阶段展现的形态宛若地球、人类的演变和进化。而在斑鸠中，男女主角森罗和篝为了意志与和平和产土神同归于尽，最终迎来和平。结局的boss战BGM前奏，也正是第一关理想BGM的前奏。

[url=http://blog.sina.com.cn/s/blog_70cc55040100lkxx.html]想了解斑鸠剧情的，可以看看这个网站。[/url]

人类最伟大的精神，莫过于执着坚持理想永不放弃。而斑鸠的男主角森罗也说过这样的话：

[b]"不留遗憾地继续走下去直至尽头。我，没有出生，就不会死去。理想事物，没有满足，就绝不屈服。这样，即使是死去，也不会后悔。"[/b]

如果让我概括母校的三航精神的话，我也会用《斑鸠》来概括。也正是这份意志，让人类走到了今天，让文明延续到了现在，让人生的存在有了价值，让生命成为了宇宙的中心。

于是所有的付出都有了意义。

37991407.review: Absolute masterpiece of a game. There are only five levels, but they all feel completely different from each other, and are masterfully made. The first level is there to get you used to the controls and mechanics of the game, level two has you navigating a somewhat destructible maze, level three has you dodging the landscape as it changes and tries to crush you, level four takes place inside and around a giant wheel which is constantly firing different colored bullets at you while trying to crash into you, and level five is more of a mini-boss rush until you get to the final showdown with the last boss. The uniqueness in the levels is my favorite feature of this game, as most shmups just send tougher mobs of enemies at you as you progress, making many of those games feel repetitive and boring to practice. The soundtrack is absolutely beautiful, and as a nice touch it is perfectly synced to the action of each stage adding a nice cinematic and epic feeling to every area and fight. The scoring system is simple, but difficult to keep a chain going for an insane score, basically you must constantly destroy enemies in threes, as long as those three enemies are the same color, you will constantly be building a higher score multiplier which is necessary for getting extra lives and climbing the scoreboard. You will quickly notice that the levels and enemy patterns are designed around this mechanic, and it requires a bit of strategy and restraint to destroy three same-colored enemies to keep your multiplier going, rather than just blasting everything as soon as it appears. Like any shmup this game is insanely difficult and requires many hours of practice on each stage to become good enough to beat the game without a continue, but because you can make half the bullets on screen harmless with the color change mechanic I do find this game to be a bit easier than say most Cave shmups, or the Touhou games for example, at least on the normal difficulty. Overall I give this game a 10/10, best shmup ever by quite a wide margin and it is a must play. Nothing comes close in any aspect.

37909477.review:
[b]Ikaruga is perfect - 10/10. The port could be better - 7/10.[/b]

Treasure have made some incredible titles over the years but Ikaruga is the one. The only problem I've noticed (in all versions) is the slight frame drop when a boss explodes, but I don't consider that a drawback because it doesn't affect play. For gameplay Ikaruga is fast, responsive and relentlessly demanding - exactly what an arcade game should be. 

Ikaruga isn't a fun little game that you can explore at your own pace, it's a gauntlet thrown down to serious gamers. If you play Dark Souls you expect to be punished and that's how you have to see it here. People think that Ikaruga is inviting them in but it's not. It's calling them out. Most modern games don't demand this level of patience and focus, and the sheer purity of a 1-coin game makes this way more than just pattern learning.

[b]Good things:[/b]

1. The game itself is flawless, precision arcade gaming.

2. Replays are a really good addition. 

[b]Problems:[/b]

1. The console UI (GameCube or Saturn) remains a lot better. With the Steam port you can only replay a whole chapter and not an individual stage. So you can't do 1-3 without having to go through 1-1 and 1-2 first. I don't know why this was dropped. Maybe something to do with the replay saves?

2. Having no Restart Stage option in the pause menu means that you have to quit, go back to the chapter menu and start again from there. That gets long. You are supposed to play Ikaruga over and over again, so the menu needs to support that with easier restarts. 

3. The UI is a bit messy. The main menu, pause menu and new menu style (i.e. all the replays, save etc.) are all different styles, colours and fonts. What's up with just using the standard Ikaruga font and design?

4. The leaderboards show fake scores at the top. The real highest score is around 4th, and you can always tell by the number of chains, but it's pretty weak for a game that prides itself on rankings.

[b]Further reading:[/b]

If you like Ikaruga then check out Mushihimesama. The hardest bullet hell game I have ever played and has a soundtrack like keygen music on crack. Total insanity but amazing fun. The YouTube vids alone make your brain bleed.

Also worth checking out rRootage, which is basically a homage to bullet hell stuff like Radiant Silvergun, Psyvariar, Gigawing and Ikaruga. Free game, with several play modes, and really good for learning the tricks of bullet hell (like the hit box of your ship being far smaller than you think)

Radiant Silvergun is a must for fans, and easily available on the online marketplaces, but real copies are nuts expensive. It's a shame because the Saturn had some amazing bullet hell games. 

Not really bullet hell but Gradius is a worthy mention. NES classic which is pretty easy to finish, but requires several playthroughs, with each getting faster and harder. Stage 5 on a 3rd playthrough is still tekkers.

37743380.review:
Let me be clear about something.

Out there somewhere, is a game designer who helped sculpt this game.  And even though you and he have never met, will never cross paths, and never have a mutual friend, I assure you...

He hates you
He hates the very idea of you
He hates your friends
He hates your parents
He hates your political stance
He hates the way you dress
He hates your favorite color
He hates your little dog, too
He hates whatever country you hail from
He hates the music you listen to
He hates the movies you watch
He hates what you did last summer
He hates the color of your hair
He hates that little knick-nack you keep on the coffee table
He hates the side of the bed you sleep on
AND he hates the other side of the bed too JUST TO SPITE YOU

And this game...*this game*, is how he releases that anger upon you.  I have never encountered such concentrated contempt in one computer program.  I was frustrated after playing for a half an hour, after an hour I was fairly sure I shamed my family's honor somehow, and after two hours I was ready to tell Vice President Cheney everything I ever knew.  If this game were translated into a real-world axiom, I would describe it as "beating a dead horse until the bones were but dust, and then chasing after each particle of dust in the wind and spitefully pounding each speck into random piles of manure just to drive home the point".

To call this game difficult insults the idea of difficult.  The game seems to be sentient and angry at ever being compiled in the first place.

I'm giving this game a recommend because apparently there is a genre for video game sadists, and this is a shining example of it.  It excels at precisely what it sets out to do.

In other notes, the rending is actually quite beautiful, the music is nice enough, and the tidbits of dialog between levels is intriguing if nothing else.  I'd still prefer Raystorm any day, however.

37690603.review:
An excellent SHMUP by the ever-brilliant Treasure. 
This game employs a clever mechanic where you can change your ship's colour to absorb bullets of the same colour, but take damage from those of the opposite colour. When you absorb enough of them, you can fire back a large laser.
It sounds simple but the level designs and enemies employ this mechanic in a very sophistacated way. 
This makes the game very challenging in a traditional, ''Nintendo-hard'' way.

I highly recommend this game to fans of SHMUPs, challenging / retro style games, and people wanting to explore innovative game mechanics.

37685509.review:
Não é divertido.

Esse jogo de nave foi realmente feito para asiáticos que jogam com precisão cirugica.

Jogos como Dark Souls dão a ilusão de dificuldade pelo tempo que você passa evoluindo e matando um chefe, não são dificeis, requer dedicação e evolução do seu personagem.

Esse tipo de jogo requer uma habilidade incalculável e precisão que não da pra acreditar.

As brechas são milimétricas e você ainda tem de se preocupar com o ambiente, que muda sem aviso e você tem que perceber o que é o fundo do cenário e o que vai te bater, além de certos jatos de tiro que te empurram pras paredes.

E não, não é somente 1 jato de tiro, existe o branco e preto, onde você inverte sua polaridade pra absorver os tiros brancos e dar mais danos nos negros, e vice e versa (nota: não lhe torna imune às naves, só aos tiros, que vem sem intervalo, ao mesmo tempo, brancos e pretos)

E a fase se mexe, aaah como se mexe. Pra esquerda, direita, inimigos vem por trás e permanecem la atirando, pela frente, sem limite.

Não é um jogo de nave casual, não é divertido, é estressante e desmotivador, pois não há evolução alguma do personagem, muito ao menos sua. Talvez da sua dor de cabeça.

Mas há quem goste. Gosto é que nem orifício anal, cada um tem o seu e faz o que quiser com ele.

37650893.review:
You probably have already seen some kind of "switching" mechanic in other games. Some of these are not much more than gimmicks. Forget about them, this game does it right with its clever stages and ennemy design.

Originally released in 2001 for Sega Naomi/DC, this still stands out today both as a very unique shoot'em up thanks to its ingenious switching mechanic, and as one of the most beautiful shmups ever created.
This could also be defined as minimalist gameplay done right (1 weapon, no bomb, no upgrades, etc.), or one of the best uses of graphics and colors tones to highlight gameplay.

敵弾と機体が同じ色なら弾消し+エネルギー吸収という点が特徴的な縦弾幕シューティング。
特筆すべきは美術的な美しさであり、黒と白で描かれる敵や背景、自機の動きすらも考慮されたステージなどは非常に美しい。

本作は2001年発売ながらも非常に美しいグラフィックであり、近年[url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/377870/DARIUSBURST_Chronicle_Saviours/]ダライアスバーストCS[/url]などグラフィックが良いシューティングが出てもなお本作が最も美しいシューティングであることは揺るぎないだろう。

反面トレジャー製ということもあり難易度は高め。
2面である程度精密な動作を要求されイージーですら敵弾吸収のパターン化が必要。コンテニューもないため、クリアにはかなりの根気が必要。
逆に言うとそれほど精密な動作が必要なシューティングであるため、上手く行ったときはただのクリア動画ですら美しくなること請け合い。

Zum Schwierigkeitsgrad: Ja, das Spiel ist bereits auf Easy gnadenlos, jede kleine Unachtsamkeit führt meist unweigerlich zum Tod. 35382996.review:
I like this game, but I don't actually like this game. At it's core Ikaruga is a rythm game that happens to be a bullet hell. It's the bullet hell of bullet hells. It's the type of game where, if you beat it the way the game intends, you could officially say you have a doctorate in bullet hells. My two biggest downvote reasons for this game: I don't like rythm games and I don't enjoy hardcore gaming. 

The controls are fluid. The gameplay is solid. However, there is a learning curve to this game that most will shy away from. I like this game ONLY when friends are over and we couch co-op with unlimited continues, because it's the only way I enjoy it. The game taunts you for not playing on hardcore reminding you that you won't get a highscore and the level bosses just go away after a certain time. Meaning if you don't play their way, they'll let you see the content, but you don't actually get to fully enjoy the game. 

I'm sure if I put a few hundred hours into Ikaruga I could be a master at this game. Unfortunately the game does nothing to entice you into playing it. The first level is turned up to 11. It's like leaving middle school and walking into a doctorate course. Expect to instantly fail...a lot! For me, that's just not fun.

3.音乐不错，不会违和，打击的音效也不错。
4.难度较高（对我而言），目前还没打过第一只BOSS，满屏的弹幕真的让人绝望。（但死过之后总是忍不住多开一局。循环往复。） 目前完了3小时，第一BOSS还是没过，分数26万。

缺点：
1.没有教学关卡。甚至没有提示。（如果我没瞎的话）。
--------------经提醒，已被打脸，非常眼瞎，在help&options. 设置投币也在里面（但是开了freepaly后，无限硬币很无聊，有钱真的是可以为所欲为，我开了5分钟，最后还是改回了off。一条命最有意思。）。

我是玩了好一会儿才发现还有个右键可以换颜色，同色吸收伤害和大招的滚轮键也是之后才摸索出来的。


总体而言，如果有幸看到这条评论的你又恰逢这游戏打折。这游戏值得购买。如果没有打折的话，我只能说这游戏值得一试。

34075972.review:
Ikaruga - один из самых уникальнейших скролл-шутеров. Ваш корабль, пули и враги могут быть одного из двух цветов, при этом вы можете менять цвет своего корабля в любой момент. Корабль поглощает пули вашего цвета и уничтожает в два раза быстрее врагов противоположного цвета. Ещё одна уникальная механика заключается в местной системе набирания очков - каждый набор врагов в игре является пазлом, где надо для увеличения счётчика Chain убивать по три врага белого или чёрного цвета. Убили двоих, а затем ошиблись цветом - Chain сбросился и вы сильно потеряете в очках. Звучит жутко, но на самом деле на первых уровнях вполне реально научиться этой механике - не стреляйте без необходимости, поскольку враги обычно не очень агрессивные.
Итак, хочу предупредить в очередной раз - вы можете забросать эту игру бесконечными продолжениями, пройти её за полчаса и забыть, заодно пожалев о потраченных деньгах. Естественно никаких впечатлений от этого не будет.
Ikaruga - достаточно сложная игра при прохождении без траты Continue (даже на Easy), но является ли она непроходимым хардкором для азиатов? Нет, не является и я тому живой пример. Когда я прошёл игру, игровой таймер показывал, что я потратил 12 часов и 20 минут - никакие годы задротства для простого прохождения не нужны. Но правда понадобятся, если вы хотите Rank S++ - вот уж в какой игре достижения по-настоящему являются достижениями.
Секрет прохождения прост - практика. Не игнорируйте режим тренировки и сидите в нём побольше. Напомню, каждый набор врагов является пазлом, на первый взгляд непроходимым, но достаточно просто найти, как двигаться и стрелять в том или ином месте, чтобы сильно понизить сложность этих мест. Дополнительно стимулирует тот факт, что за очки дают жизни, но необязательно стремиться к мировому рекорду - я и трети этого рекорда не смог набрать, а тем не менее прошёл. При всей кажущейся невозможности происходящего игра поразительно честная, в ней нет смертельного рандома, у неё просто высокий входной порог. Но если вы любите скролл-шутеры и любите разбираться в них, вы получите один из самых уникальных игровых опытов и вовсе не пожалеете об этом.

33946706.review:
[h1]シューティングというジャンルに目覚めさせてくれた不屈の名作『斑鳩』[/h1]

このゲームに出会ったのは10年以上前。

他のSTGとは明らかにレベルの違うレベルの3Dグラフィクスによる描画で当時は度肝を抜かれた。

(HD解像度の今では、ところどころポリゴンメッシュが足りてない感はあるが、それでも完成度は高い。そもそも当時はNTSC解像度・・・それでこれほどのクオリティとは、ただただ感服するばかり。）



そしてゲーム内容ですが、敵弾に当たりに行くという、STGジャンルでは革新的なアイデアが盛り込まれたSTGとなっている。

白と黒の属性を切り替えながら、敵弾をうまく吸収してエネルギーを貯め、力の解放(ホーミングレーザー)を使って攻略していく。

最初はこの白と黒の切替と敵弾の属性に訳がわからなくなり、なんとまあ難しいゲームだろうと思うのだが、各ステージのマップデザインも良くできていて、何度もやっているとちょっとずつ先にすすめるようになり、進めば進むほど攻略のしかたが増えて楽しくなっていく。



ゲームにも少し慣れ、ちょっと攻略できるようになってくると、このゲームのミソであるチェインコンボも多少やりたくなってくる。

同属性の敵を3体ずつ倒すと、徐々にスコアが加算されていき、最高で25600点(8チェイン以上)のボーナスが毎チェインごとにもらえる。

上手い人のプレイを一度見てみるとわかるが、とにかくチェインを繋いでいく斑鳩がとてつもなくかっこよく、見ていてとても気持ちよくなることだろう。

こんな斑鳩プレイヤーに自分もなりたいと思って、自分なりにパターンを考えてチェインを繋いでいけたとき、このゲームがとてつもなく楽しく感じられるようになる…

そして納得いくプレイができたとき、なんともいえぬ達成感を得ることができるだろう。



ゲーム難易度はEASY、NORMAL、HARDの3種類で、基本的に同じシステムなのだが、打ち返し弾があるだけでこれほど攻略のしかたが変わるのもとても面白い。

EASYは斑鳩の基本の白と黒の属性をうまく使って撃っていき…

NORMALは、同属性同士での撃ち返し弾をうまく吸収して、斑鳩のロマンとも言える開放を惜しみなく使って攻略していけ...

HARDは別属性ででも撃ち返してくる弾を誘導、あるいはSTG本来のプレーである避けをしながら、最大量の敵弾をかいくぐり攻略していく...

難易度によってパターンも変わり、とにかくよくできているなぁと感心してやまない。



また、ゲームを盛り上げるBGMもとてもかっこよく、ゲームとしての完成度は本当に高い。



他の会社のSTGもいくつかやったが、どのSTGが一番好きかと言われたら、やっぱり斑鳩と答えるであろう。



オススメです。

33289675.review:
This isn't so much an arcade shoot 'em up as a high intensity puzzle game. The primary aim is to survive each level by avoiding bullets of the opposite polarity to your ship - for example if your polarity is white, your ship is invulnerable to white bullets, but contact with a black bullet will kill you.

The secondary aim is to maximise your score by 'chaining' enemy kills by polarity, i.e. destroying enemies of the same polarity in groups of three. Each chain increases your score multiplier - which affects the points awarded by each individual kill - by a factor of one. The higher your score, the higher your grade at the end of each level. The highest grades can only be achieved with very high score multipliers. 

Alternatively you can complete each level without firing once by avoiding bullets of the opposite polarity until the timer reaches zero. You're awarded with a special grade and ranking on a separate leaderboard.

The layout of enemies and their bullet patterns is identical each playthrough, and therefore repeated attempts are the key to success. Memorise enemy patterns, identify how to continuously chain enemy kills, and ultimately become good enough to complete the game in a single credit!

A full playthrough tales approximately 25 minutes, but it will take many hours of practice before this can be achieved with just three lives. 

Ikaruga expects you to die over and over again, but persevere and you [b]will[/b] progress. The further you go, the more you learn. 

Fast reflexes and limitless patience are a good start!

32840393.review:
¿Dolor? YO devoro el dolor... literal...
Ikaruga es un juego shoot em´ up y Danmahku lanzado primeramente en Sega NAOMI y luego a la Dreamcast y GameCube, considerandose como un sucesor espiritual de Radiant Silvergun.
El juego es para ti si te gustan este genero de juegos y la dificultad estilo Danmahku o Bullet Hell, claro, tomando en cuenta el hecho de que la dinamica de este juego es diferente a la de un Gradius, Fantasy Zone, etc.
En lo personal a mi me gusto mucho, si fue lo que esperaba y ademas el soundtrack encaja bien en el momento en el que se le ponen a reproducir, siendo mi favorito el tema del segundo jefe, 仏法僧 (Buppousou).

Pros
+Dificultad. A pesar de ser solo 5 niveles, vas a tener un buen rato intentando completarlos.
+Soundtrack.
+Compatbilidad estable con control (Lo jugue con un DualShock 4).

Contras
-Objetivamente, tal vez el juego se pudo haber excedido con el cambio MUY notable entre el primer nivel y el segundo, lo cual puede ser incomodo para algunos (Aunque para mi no lo fue).

9.5/10
Si no fuera por Fantasy Zone II, este seria mi juego favorito de Shoot em´ up.

31540196.review:
おすすめとはしているけど、手放しでおすすめできる訳ではありません。

個人的にもアーケード版(NAOMI)が現役稼働していた時から知ってるゲームでしたが、何年もの間、正直な感想は「名作だの傑作だのと言われているものの…なんだかプレイしてみてもぜんぜん楽しくない。まぁ…上手い人のプレイ動画は楽しめるけど…」と、そんな感じでした。
（今はもちろん違いますよ。すごく楽しい。けど、むやみに人に勧められない…）

そんなわけで、このゲームは楽しむためのスタート地点に立つ事自体にちょっとしたハードルがある事。また、そのハードルはプレイヤー自身の意思で乗り越える必要がある…という点が手放しでおすすめできない理由です。

でも、そのハードルもSteam版では多少は乗り越えやすいのかなとも思います。
ランキングとリプレイ機能（Xbox360版と違って100位までとかいう制限が無い！）が充実しているので、突破できない所や安定しない所を自分より少し上手い人のリプレイを参考に、実行出来そうなパターンを自分自身のパターンに組み込んで少しずつ先を目指す…という事を繰り返しながらプレイするのが良いでしょう。
そうしているうちに楽しむ為のハードルを乗り越えている事に気づくはずです。
逆にいえばこういう方法でゲームを攻略していくのは苦痛…というのであればこのゲームはおすすめできません。

きちんと楽しみたいのであればコンティニューは有効にせず1コインクリアを目指すプレイをする事をおすすめします。
（もちろんコンティニューは封印していても、Chapter毎の練習はやりまくってください。）
どのChapterでも評価Aが出せるぐらいになると本当の楽しさが見えてくると思いますよ。

31264034.review:
Если кратко - это достойный представитель своего жанра, стоит попробовать, если вы фанат.

Длинно - очень не рекомендую её брать, если не фанат и охота попробовать лишь лучшие образчики. Главная геймплейная фишка Икаруги не только дает уникальный геймплей сама по себе, но и добавляет ещё один слой сложности к прочим. Чтобы выбить местную платину, нужно не просто быть корейцем и доджить как бог, нужно также следить за заполнением чейна, чтобы он не сбросился, следить за полярностью, следить, какие пульки можно принять на грудь, а какие нет. Вся игра должна быть пройдена в ритме танца, от начала и до конца, практически на одном дыхании, иначе не видать S++.
Лично мне не понравилась графика. Я не знаю, каким образом все было исполнено в 2001 году на автомате, в данной версии господствует 3Д. Модели и текстуры очень бедные. В тех случаях, когда задники не трехмерные, детализация также не блещет. Есть некоторые проблемы с распознаванием текущей полярности в гуще сражения; на поздних уровнях, когда все застлано вражескими снарядами, текстурку самого корабля толком не видно (не проблема для хардкорщиков, которые в состоянии запомнить, сколько раз они прожали смену полярности).
Музыка отличная, ничего плохого не скажу. Звуки сносные, в некоторых ситуациях кораблик может сильно надоесть своим компьютерным голосом, сообщающим, что заряд ракет полон (драка с боссом финальной главы).

[b]6.9/10[/b]

29976360.review:
斑鳩は演出・ゲーム性、共に非常に優れている縦スクロールシューティングゲームです。
斑鳩のBGMはゲーム内の展開と完全に同期しており、それらの相互作用はプレイヤーの感情を刺激することに役立ちます。そのため、ストーリーが理解出来なくても、ゲームを進めている内に、何か壮大な目的に近づいているんだな、ということを感じられる様になっています。
とりわけシューティングというジャンルは、作中でストーリーを説明するには不向きな面がありますが、それをカットシーンにおける斑鳩の挙動やステージ自体の構造にBGMを加えた演出によって、2017年現在でも語り継がれる完成度の演出が出来上がっています。

しかし、その演出を堪能するには、飛鉄塊(敵機)の出現パターンを頭に叩き込む必要があります。
飛鉄塊の出現パターンは異常な作り込みが伺えます。Chapter.2以降からはステージの地形を考慮した動きをしなくてはならず、独特のスコアシステムも相まってクリアまでの道のりは相当に困難です。
これについては先人達の動きを真似するのがよいと思います。インターネットランキングからリプレイをダウンロードすることが出来る為、近いスコアの人のリプレイを見ることで同じ腕前の人がどの様な動きをしているのか分かります。
まるで答え合わせの様なプレイには抵抗があると思いますが、かつてのアーケードにおいては、他人のプレイを見ていいとこ取りをするのは当たり前のことだと思いますので、それが更に発展した形であるインターネットランキングは活用しない手がありません。
とにかく最初は、それぞれのチャプター全体の流れを把握する、自機が今何色なのか身体で覚える、破壊時の撃ち返し弾に当たる危険があるため自機のショットが画面内にあるうちは属性変更をしない、これを念頭に置くべきだと思います。
EASY MENUをONにすると再プレイが捗ります。

29284205.review: Believe the hype, winning this game on 1 continue is damn near impossible. However, that's probably not the best way for new players to approach it. In the options menu you can give yourself extra continues as well as extra hits. I would advise allowing yourself a lot of lives to begin with, and then slowly attempting to beat the game using less and less continues. This way you get to unlock and practice each level. If you go the purist route you're just going to end up replaying the first two stages over and over, and getting creamed later on. It gets repetitive REAL quick and you'll only ever see about half the game.  Oh and since this is meant to be a review I should probably mention that the game is a masterpiece. All hail Treasure!

29124440.review:
This game is a great example why steam needs a third option: Nuetral (aka the: Not not recommending it)

While I won't say Ikaruga is a bad game because of its difficulty, because let's face it it started as a money making arcade game and because many people enjoy games that are overly difficult, but there are a handful of things that really should have been added/changed with a pc port.

First off: give us more gameplay options, especially easier modes or infinite continues etc. If you're a purist who wants the difficulty then just ignore the easy ones like you already are (you have no reason to disagree with such additions). If you're not a purist then hey you'll actually have a decent chance of finishing the full game.

Secondly: why the fuck can you not skip ANY of the cutscenes?

Thirdly: There is a few issues I have with the menus. They are outdated need to be tweaked a bit overall, but more specifically there are some points at which you can't back out and have to go into a playthrough so you can quit back to the main title.

Lastly: This game should not be having performance issues (note that most performance issues do not occure during actual gameplay). If you are going to ignore everything else at least put forth the effort to make sure you game runs well on the platform you are porting it to. This is a blatent disregard for quality/effort

In summary Ikaruga is a great game, but I cannot recommend this port of it. It's clearly a creation done entirely just to make more money rather than give new/more players the opportunity to experience it. That being said I wouldn't not recommend the game.

我是手残我是手残我是手残!
但不影响我热爱这款硬邦邦的STG神作!

TREASURE和GAME ARTS是我最推崇的两个日本中小厂. 它们在16位~32位主机时代的每一部作品都是可以拿得出手的神作! 例如16bBIT时代的SILPHEED, GUNSTAR HERO, LUNAR; 32BIT时代的RADIANT SILVERGUN, GRANDIA, GUARDIAN HEROES, GUN GRIFFON... 

游戏难度很高, 但内藏玄机, 我看过S级视频, 阴阳调和地推进游戏简直是如鱼得水的境界. 游戏的对话中还隐藏着"色即是空空即是色"这种出世观, 令宅男迷糊, 令腐女投降. 配合阴阳变换的射击系统, 玩着玩着总有点疑似入道的错觉...

有很多话想说, 可惜码字很辛苦, 有兴趣加我慢慢聊...

28794682.review:
Ikaruga — это классическая игра жанра shoot 'em up, разработчиком которой выступила компания Treasure. Из их игр я играл в хардкорные Gunstar Heroes (похожа на Contra Hard Corps в хорошем смысле) и Alien Soldier, если интересно, они есть в steam. 

Геймплей сосредоточен на механике смены полярностей (смена цвета вашего корабля в любое время) и состоит из стрельбы по летающим противникам, которые либо белого, либо черного цвета. Только пули противоположной полярности (цвет белый и черный) могут уничтожить игрока. Также корабль игрока способен поглощать пули противника одинакого цвета и преобразовать в особое оружие. Изменение полярности (цвета) корабля также меняет цвет снарядов и такие пули наносят двойной урон противникам противоположного цвета (белый цвет корабля наносит больший урон противникам черного цвета и наоборот). Таким образом большая часть игры представляет собой выбор между высоким уровнем нанесения урона и относительной неуязвимости. Особенно эти отличительные черты геймплея проявляются в боях с боссами (как же сложно блин, я не могу пройти второго босса), потому что надо использовать оба вида полярностей (белый и черный цвет). Я наверное вас запутал, только хардкор ребята...

В игре симпатичная 3D графика, замечательный саундтрек и гибкая настройка управления+

В итоге я рекомендую приобрести игру только тем, кто любит хардкор, а игра дествительно очень сложная, даже режим "easy" вас не спасет, я вас предупредил.

28709106.review:
I got this thinking it was like "Super Spacefortress Macross" Arcade version, with updated graphics. But it is not & I did not enjoy this game at all.

Personal optional: 

- Concept of switching between white & dark energy is cool, but not "realistic" & it made it very difficult to play. If a dark bullet hits a white ship, you die instantly. I find myself wondering wouldn't the same rule apply to the enemy? If a white enemy accidentally touch a dark enemy, shouldn't they both explode?

- Background/ backdrop of where your ship is flying over, is distracting, sometimes it looks like a real photograph of trees, sometimes it is a 3D space? 

- Again back to "realism". At level 2, there's giant blocks moving around. Is this battlefield inside a base? If yes, how does the enemy fly in or out of these blocks themselves? 

I just saw "DELTAZEAL" gameplay on Youtube. I should have got that instead, since it looked more like macross.

28664622.review:
Although I love Shoot 'em ups and I've bought this during sale, I have never felt so bad about buying a game.
Although the majority of the reviews are very positive, I don't think it's right for me.
First of all, it's insanely difficult. If you like challenges, this might be for you. On the other hand, if you enjoy playing a fun and relaxing game, streer away from this one.
The other thing that bugs me is that there are no power-ups. I might be old fashioned, but shiny effects and overly-powerful weapons are what make me happy in this genre. There are no bombs which help you get out of a tight spot by clearing the screen. Not even an option to shoot in reverse or to the sides. And trust me, enemies will be coming from all areound.
In order to enjoy this, you really need to be focused to pilot around hundreds of obstacles appearing on the screen at the same time and you have to be really fast on the polarity switch finger. Polarity is a thing that helps you absorb bullets from the same-colored enemies, while being vulnerable to the other color. It also deals double damage to the opposite color.

So... Enjoy if you can or rage quit like I did after going through endless "continue game" options on easy mode during the first few stages.

STGは得意ではなく、面白さはわかるものの、
触りだけの面白さで全てを知った風な感じで投げる。
そんな下手の横好きです。(弾幕とかまぐれで抜けて喜ぶくらいの腕前)

2016年の8月から始めて、12月現在Chapter4ボスまでいけるようになりました。(Easyですが)
最初は頃はChapter1くらいはクリアできたものの、
稼ぎは考えずクリアできればいいやー程度だったのですが、
Chapter2あたりからはここをこうやって撃っていくとチェインが繋がるな？
みたいな感じで毎日数回プレイを続けているうちに、
どんどんチェインがつながってどんどん難しくなっていく。
そうなるとChapter1もこうやれば？みたいな感じで沼にハマる。
それが斑鳩です。

そして、斑鳩はとても難しいです。
難しいですがSTG的な考え方を持っていなくても、
続けて遊んでいれば抜け方、繋ぎ方が見えてくるような作りで、
そこはさすが名作と言われているだけのことはあります。
この要素が特に面白いのでやるならじっくりと遊んでほしいです。

点数を稼ぎ始めると上手い人のリプレイを見て、最初は簡単にみえるものの、
自分がそこにたどり着き、同じような動きをしてみると、
「なんだこれ！意味がわからない！簡単そうに見えたのに！！」
みたいな感じになるのでやるなら是非稼ぎもやってほしいとは思いますw

28077116.review:
アーケードゲームとして2001年に稼働した名作縦スクロールシューティングの移植版。
自機・自弾・敵・敵弾などに「白」か「黒」の属性があり、同属性の敵弾は吸収してホーミングレーザーに変えることができる。
終始統一された独特な世界観の元に展開される美麗なグラフィック、上述の属性システムを活かした精緻なパズルのようなステージ構成、ゲームの進行に同期するBGMが相俟って圧倒される。
シューティングゲームの域を超えた芸術作品と呼ぶにふさわしい。

27224612.review:
Mucha gente cae en el error de que un juego que retome la jugabilidad 2D no puede ser original, ya que aparentemente los juegos desarrollados en los ejes X e Y dieron todo lo que podían dar de sí en la era de los 16 bits. "Ikaruga" demuestra que esto no es cierto ya que a pesar de emplear uno de los sistemas de juego más antiguos de los videojuegos, ofrece una idea realmente innovadora que lo aparta de todos sus semejantes: El sistema de la polaridad. 

Las naves, tanto la nuestra como las enemigas, tienen dos polaridades o colores: blanco y negro (aunque en la versión de NGC parecen más bien azul y rojo). Lo que diferencia a nuestra nave, llamada por cierto Ikaruga, de las enemigas es que podemos cambiar entre una polaridad y otra cuando queramos. De este modo, cuando nuestra nave esté en la polaridad blanca, por ejemplo, podrá absorber los disparos de ese mismo color que sean disparados desde las naves enemigas también blancas. No obstante, si nos alcanza un disparo de color negro nuestra nave será destruida. Esto se cumple también en el caso contrario, cuando nuestra nave es negra. A medida que vayamos absorbiendo disparos se irá rellenando una barra de energía que nos permitirá realizar un potente disparo especial. 

Como es natural si disparamos a una nave con disparos del color opuesto le infringiremos el doble de daño. Es decir, si disparamos con disparos blancos a una nave negra, acabaremos con ella antes y viceversa. Esto resulta de especial importancia contra los jefes finales. Pero hay que tener cuidado si derribamos a una nave de nuestra misma polaridad, ya que en este caso nuestro caído enemigo soltará una especie de "metralla" en la explosión que nos puede comprometer si cambiamos de polaridad demasiado deprisa. 

Y Treasure ha sabido manejar este novedoso sistema con verdadera maestría. Naves de las dos polaridades llegarán de todas partes llenando toda la pantalla de disparos de ambos colores poniendo a prueba así nuestros reflejos y nuestra capacidad de atención para intentar cambiar de una polaridad a otra mientras derribamos a nuestros enemigos. Toda una delicia y todo un desafío. 

A todo esto hay que sumarle las características típicas de los Shooter matamarcianos como las naves enemigas que resisten varios impactos, diferentes clases de obstáculos que deberemos ir esquivando y los obligados enemigos finales. Treasure consigue un elevadísimo nivel en todos estos apartados. Si a esto le añadimos lo anteriormente explicado (incluyendo la conseguida sensación de velocidad en varios puntos) y un control tan sencillo que casi asusta (un botón de disparo, otro para cambiar la polaridad, otro para hacer el disparo especial y "chim-pam-pum-sanseacabó") obtenemos un cóctel verdaderamente explosivo.
"Ikaruga" posee un número de modos de juego algo escaso pero en cualquier caso superior a la media de lo que nos tiene acostumbrados este género: 

- Arcade: El de toda la vida. Hay dos versiones, una "trial" que solo abarca los dos primeros capítulos (ideal para principiantes) y la normal con los 5 capítulos de la versión Arcade original. Hay tres modos de dificultad disponibles, los cuales varían de uno a otro según la "metralla" que sueltan los enemigos al morir. En el modo fácil los enemigos no soltarán metralla; en el modo normal solo soltarán metralla si derribamos a un enemigo con utilizando su misma polaridad; en el modo difícil, los enemigos siempre soltaran metralla al ser destruidos. 

- Práctica: El nombre lo dice todo. Solo se puede practicar en aquellas fases del modo Arcade que hayamos superado sin haber usado continuaciones. 

- Conquista: En este modo de juego, las fases están divididas en áreas detalladas según cada una. Se puede jugar en tres velocidades distintas (Demo, Lento y Normal) para habituarse al juego, aunque la idea es jugar en modo Normal. Al igual que en el modo práctica, solo se pueden jugar en aquellas fases que hayan sido superadas en el modo Arcade sin haber usado continuaciones. 

- Desafío: O lo que es lo mismo, el modo Arcade para competir en los rankings de internet. No, no es que este juego tenga opción de juego on-line. Simplemente, cuando se nos acabe la partida, bien por haber llegado hasta el final, bien por haber perdido todas las vidas (lo más frecuente será esto último), se nos dará una contraseña de doce caracteres que después deberemos introducir en la página web oficial de "Ikaruga" y comparar nuestras puntuaciones con las de jugadores de todo el mundo. 

A todo esto sumarle la posibilidad de jugar a dos jugadores cooperativamente en todos los modos de juego. 

Ahora bien, estas opciones pueden parecer pocas, pero la durabilidad de "Ikaruga" está más que garantizada merced a uno de los niveles de dificultad más alto y a la vez más adictivas de la presente generación. Y es que el título de Treasure es, como se dice vulgarmente, "difícil de narices". Entre la gran cantidad de enemigos y disparos que llega a haber en pantalla al mismo tiempo, el retorcido diseño de niveles en lo que a obstáculos se refiere y el frenetismo de la acción, "Ikaruga" es un juego de dificultad muy elevada incluso en el modo fácil. Pero a pesar de que moriremos bastante a menudo, el juego es tan endiabladamente adictivo que dicha dificultad no llega a ser excesivamente frustrante, al menos para jugadores de habilidad media/alta. Si hablamos de jugadores más inexpertos... la cosa cambia. Si eres de los que se desesperan con juegos difíciles, "Ikaruga" no es demasiado aconsejable. 

También hay que tener muy en cuenta que "Ikaruga" es, por encima de todo, un juego para amantes del género de los shooter. Si eso de derribar naves nunca te gustó demasiado, este título no te hará cambiar de opinión y menos con esa dificultad. No obstante, si eres un amante del género, "Ikaruga" es un imprescindible casi obligatorio. Del mismo modo si eres de los que se quejan de que esta generación solo ha dado juegos "para paquetes" y buscas un título en el cual vayas a morir 15 veces mínimo antes de conseguir avanzar (¡Que los hay! ¡Y muchos!), "Ikaruga" supone todo un reto a tu habilidad que a buen seguro te dejará satisfecho. 

Así es "Ikaruga". Una verdadera joya de las talentosas mentes de los chicos de Treasure. Un diamante en bruto que, aunque no sea apto para todo el mundo, proporcionará diversión a raudales a todos aquellos que sepan apreciarlo.

26970516.review:
[b]Disclaimer:[/b] Playtime should probably be around 75-100 hours, as I played the crap out of the GCN version back in the day (which is still sitting on my shelf).

This is in my humble opinion the best shoot-em-up of all time, and while I'm not a hardcore fan of the genre, I have played enough to feel that it's a decent title for that mantle.  I've rarely played a game developed by Treasure that disappoints, and this is probably their best.

The incredible visuals (which have aged exceptionally well), the amazing musical score and sound effects already set this game apart from many shooters.  However, the unique "polarity" mechanic and simple, straightforward controls truly make this game remarkable and unique, even compared to others developed by Treasure.  

The ability to absorb attacks that would otherwise destroy you, and to have control over this mechanic for every attack in the game, adds a level of depth and strategy that isn't typical of games in this genre.  The mechanic is easy to understand, but often extremely difficult to apply optimally.

This mechanic is displayed throughout the masterfully crafted stages, which is the trademark of any Treasure game.  You would be hard pressed to find a shoot-em-up developer that can create stages that seem so chaotic and tense yet are so deliberate and organized in design.

I should warn that this game isn't for the faint of heart.  It's disgustingly difficult to master and really demands a lot of concentration and pattern recognition from the player to find success.  The only payoffs are bragging rights and hi-scores, which both come with a sense of accomplishment that you've overcome such a difficult game.

26914560.review:
[b]Note: actual playtime should be between 350-400 hours over arcade and GC, I bought it on Steam too for completionism's sake.[/b]

[h1]The Good:[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Exceptional art department, both the graphics & soundtrack are top-notch.
    [*]State of the art gameplay. There are no effective ways to actually describe it, you'll have to play it - even gameplay videos don't do it justice. Grab a controller and let it flow like water.
    [*]Easy to get into, hard to master.
    [*]As the description says, it can be played "as intended" in its full arcade glory if you have a flippable screen (if you like shmups, chances are you already have one such screen, or plan on getting one).
    [*]The [i]de facto[/i] spiritual successor of Radiant Silvergun.
[/list]

[h1]The Bad:[/h1]
[list]
    [*]As a shmup on Steam it works under the assumption that you have a controller. Do not play this with a keyboard. Aside from this rather obvious note, nothing comes to mind, really.
[/list]

[h1]TL;DR:[/h1]

If you like shmups and for some unfathomable reason haven't tried Ikaruga yet, well, what in the world are you waiting for?

If you have a controller and feel like getting into shmups, this is most certainly a good way to do just that.

First two levels are alright then the game goes full quarter mun-cher. Level four in particular will eat your lunch.
There's no quick and easy way to restart a level in practice mode, which is actually quite aggravating if you're rehearsing a high score run, which is further exacerbated by Ikaruga's unforgiving grading; You pretty much have to memorize enemy placement for the entire level if you don't want a C grade. Every time you want to restart, you have to go all the way back to the title screen then set it all up again, which seems unreasonable for a level select mode.
Despite my complaining, this 2001 game still looks pretty good, has a great aesthetic and a strong soundtrack to back it up.
Get it on sale if you like arcade shmups, this game is a classic for a reason.

25620646.review:
I will not die until I achieve something.
Even though the ideal is high, I never give in.
Therefore, I never die with regrets.
-----------------------------------------------
Ikaruga is an absolute gem. It's one of the best (and hardest) shoot'em up games i've ever played.
Ikaruga consists of 5 levels which some of them are insanely hard (I'm not joking) and if you want to upload you highscores to the leaderboards of save your replay, you have to beat the whole game with 3 lives and 0 continues. But if you want, you can enable continues from the options menu to make it easier.
In addition to the usual mechanics in shoot'em up games, this game features ((Polarity)) mechanic. Your ship has two forms/colors (blue and red) and by switching between them, you can avoid being hit by the projectiles that have the same color and absorb them to unleash a powerful attack (blue form/color absorbs blue projectiles and red form/color absorbs red projectiles).
By killing 3 enemies of the same color in a row, you get one ((Chain)) bonus that resets if you kill enemies without using the said pattern. Earning chains is very important if you want to get high scores and grades (and also achievements) at the end of each level; but it can also become very hard in final levels.

Pros:
- Challenging Gameplay
- Amazing Soundtracks
- Co-Op Support
- Polarity Mechanic

Cons:
- Nothing

25515045.review:
Played it back then on the GameCube, but the truth of the matter is: you can't ever have enough copies of Ikaruga, so adding it to my Steam library some time was inevitable. 

Ikaruga is the very definition of a "bullet hell" arcade shooter, with the twist of the player being able to reverse the polarity of the ship at any time to enable it to either absorb light or dark bullets in order to fill a power bar that allows to unleash a devastating attack on the rather well-fortified enemies.

Sounds like a walk in the park then? Nah, not at all. There may be even more crazy shmups than this (and all of them seem to come from asia ... I see a pattern here), but if you have nerves of steel, want to gain nerves of steel or just have masochistic tendencies in general (it has a 2 player mode, so a sorrow shared is a sorrow halved I guess), Ikaruga is a must have. Also, on a side note, the Level 1 music is so incredibly catchy that I still remembered it over all the years.

The PC port is smooth sailing, graphics are okay and aged well, music is good to superb, bullets are reasonably deadly, pacing is lightning fast. Not a game for everyone of course, but a classic when it comes to this genre.

24556755.review:
自分が人生で出会った最高のゲームのひとつ。
白黒を切り替え弾を吸収するというシンプルなギミックながら、STGとして完成されたレベルデザインが素晴らしい。
難易度も一筋縄では行かないほど高いが、プレイする度に上達が実感できるような巧みな構成になっている。
ストイックさを追求したシンプルなグラフィックデザイン、儚さを感じさせる世界観と演出、耳の奥まで染み入るサウンド。
全てのパーツがこれでもかというほど綺麗に組み上がった作品。
クリアしたあとは『素晴らしい作品に出会ってしまったな』という感覚に浸れます。
もちろんUIやゲームモードもストレスなく構成されています。
ゲーム好きを公言するユーザーならば、ぜひともプレイしていただきたいタイトルのひとつです。

24556086.review:
Putroppo, il sistema di giudizio "Consigliato" "Non consigliato" è estremamente arbitrario. Alla fine ho messo consigliato perché il gioco piace a ME. Ma tu, che hai sfogliato per caso questo gioco in negozio e adesso stai scorrendo velocemente le recensioni, presta attenzione.

Avrei voluto mettere  sconsigliato solo perché parliamo di un gioco ASSOLUTAMENTE NON per tutti. E non lo dico tanto per fare il grosso, anzi...

Mettete pure difficoltà Facile, se volete, ma cambia poco, in quanto eviterete solamente del fuoco di ritorno dai nemici distrutti... sai che agevolazione quando lo schermo è colmo di lucine colorate che ti vengono addosso.

Per enorme fortuna dei giocatori, la meccanica principale del gioco implica il cambiare costantemente il polo della propria astronave da positivo a negativo (Bianco e Rosso scuro). Non solo sarete immuni a tutti gli attacchi del rispettivo polo corrente, ma assorbendo tali colpi caricherete la classica barra di energia che, se riempita al massimo, rilascerà un super attacco. Inoltre, se sarete così audaci da andare contro navi nemiche del polo opposto (esponendovi inevitabilmente al pericolo) questi subiranno il doppio dei danni.

Ma sprovveduti siete se pensate che la cosa sia così lineare: più navi e attacchi dei due diversi poli si alterneranno senza tregua già al primo livello, e in alcune parti sarà praticamente impossibile andare avanti senza padroneggiare questa meccanica.

Ah, quasi dimenticavo: avete soltanto tre vite; se le perdete: Game over.

E qui arriviamo al difetto concreto del gioco, che vi farà diventare dei progamer per forza: l'attesa.

Una volta morti, dovrete aspettare minimo un minuto affinché il gioco salvi il punteggio, per poi rispedirvi al menu principale; quindi, per tornare a giocare, dovrete reimpostare tutte le opzioni di gioco daccapo tutte le volte.

In pratica, le prime volte, quando schiatterete tre volte di fila senza nemmeno aver lasciato il vostro Hangar, impiegherete più tempo per avviare il gioco che per "giocare". Consideratelo uno stimolo ad impegnarvi per vincere.

Quindi ragazzino, se sei il tipo da bestemmiare tutto il calendario solo perché il miniPekka non ha raggiunto la torre della corona avversaria perché distratto dalla banda di Goblin, non scomodare quei preziosi otto euro per questo gioco ed usali , invece, per livellarti il Principe.

機能面のレビューです　ウィンドウズ10で動作確認をしています

XBOX360版でのおかしなところは修正されています

steam版ではこれらがきちんとオリジナル通りに修正されています

ゲーセンNAOMI版とドリキャス版にはある
難易度選択で白服の主人公の男性がゆっくり歩いている

機能面のレビューです
プレイ環境作りの各種設定がとても充実しています

コントローラー設定の充実も良く、
ビットトレードワン製のREVIVE　USBにも対応

メイン操作に使うショット・属性変更・力の開放は
それぞれをボタン2つに割り当てる事もできます

※使うボタンが1つでいい場合は
「もう1つのボタン選択時」にキーボードのEscキーを押します
ここは少しわかりにくい所です


スタート（ポーズ）ボタン
メニュー内での項目決定・項目キャンセルボタンも
任意のボタンに割り当てられます



設定で勘違いしやすいところですが
ショット・属性変更・力の開放ボタンの設定は
メニュー内の「コントローラーセッティング」の項目で行いますが、

項目確定・キャンセル・ポーズボタンの任意変更は
同メニュー内の「ゲームパッド」の項目で行いますので
混乱しないようにご注意ください





ワイドではない旧モニターにも
もちろんフルスクリーンで対応していますし
各種モニタサイズや縦画面にも対応しています

縦画面はどちらを上にするかの選択が可能です
　
さらに細かい画質調整機能のほかに
画面全体にかかっているグラフィック効果のON/OFFもでき、
XBOX360版で加えられたであろう
グラフィックの効果を消す事ができるので
NAOMIやドリキャス版のようなオリジナルな質感にもできます

壁紙も真っ黒が選択できます

画面全体のレイアウトはスコア位置やゲージ位置なども細かく調整できますし
余計なものが無いオリジナルのゲーセン風や
壁紙と実績表示ありのネシカ風など設定の組み合わせで色々と選べます


しかしゲームのメイン画面部の拡大縮小・上下左右の
微調整機能はありません


さらに画面オプションで横シューとして遊ぶ事が可能です
横画面のまま縦画面モードでのコントローラーの対応はもちろん、
なんと各種表示や「斑鳩ポエム」も
横シューモードの専用表示が用意されているという
メーカーこだわりの仕様です


音楽と効果音の調整が可能です

Escキーによるゲーム中の強制終了はできません
メニューからゲームをやめるを選択して終了させます
AltとF4キーによる強制終了は可能です


ちょっとした画像資料集と
サウンドテストを兼ねたミニ小説付きです

これを買えば
斑鳩のためにXBOX360・ドリキャス・ゲームキューブを持っている方は
押し入れにしまってもいいです

23676344.review:
tl;dr for the obsessive type a must have, well designed and fair but extremely challenging game.

Infamous Ikaruga, if you haven't seen some videos online, do so. Quite obviously this is a game for people who have the tendency to be perfectionists, who love to grind every last bit out of levels and don't mind starting over quite often.

There are many games which are difficult because they are poorly designed, have stupid controls, weird hitboxes, are unfair, have too much random elements, distracting visuals... not the case here!

Controls, Gameplay, Hitboxes, Visuals, everything is perfect. The hitboxes are very well done, so it really has to hit your ship for you to die, so no frustration in that regard, just as it should be.

[b]The game mechanic:[/b]

While being white you can absorb blue enemy fire to charge your special attack and red fire will instantly kill you (the other way around when you are black). You can switch back and forth as you wish. But here the twist: If your "polarity" (the game uses this term) is different from your enemy, you do twice the damage. So being black shooting white (or the other way around) does twice the damage to your enemy, but dodging enemy fire then can be really tricky (as a single shot of the opposite polarity will instantly kill you), this also means you can't charge your special attack by absorbing enemy fire while being of a different polarity.

And another nice feature: Changing polarity is very quick, but not instant. So if you are white and want to change since there is some red fire incoming you can't possibly dodge, you have to anticipate that slightly before.

So the mechanic is quite simplistic, but also somewhat brilliant. You have to concentrate quite seriously at times and there are various strategies how to approach different enemy formations.

Especially if you are striving for a highscore the game immensely rewards playing well, and punishes mistakes brutally. So it doesn't matter how long you are able to survive, 20 seconds of good play will trump 2 minutes of dodging everything. And that's how it should be. Having chains of streaks (shooting 3 enemies of same polarity in a row) will boost your score immensely and the goal is to keep this up as consistently as possible (and the enemy formations allow you to keep this up if you play perfectly).

The first chapter is quite alright on hard, but the progression from there on is brutal.
(I probably would have clocked more hours playing it, but there is no Linux port and I currently don't have any Windows machines)

23186982.review: Anyone who's a fan of the shmup genre has at least heard of Ikaruga. It's a beautiful game that was previously on the gamecube and later ported to other systems. It's often cited as being one of the hardest shmups (and games in general) of all time. That's not a joke or an exaggeration. If you think you're going to walk into this game and beat it easily (without unlimited continues) you're wrong. It's very tough but also very rewarding with its dual phase mechanic. If your ship is black, you absorb black bullets and die in one hit. If you're white, it's the opposite. You have to use this mechanic to survive as the enemies will be blanketing the screen in bullets and lasers trying to kill you with alternating colors. I very much recommend this game but be aware that if you don't like hard games, this one may not be for you.

22784294.review: Ikaruga's biggest strength is the fact that it plays like a puzzle game despite it being a shump. Unlike Radiant Silvergun, there are only two weapons (standard shot, and a series of lasers), and enemies have two color schemes (black and white) as suppose to three (red, blue, and yellow). Ikaruga has several improvements over Silvergun: The game is more fast-paced than its predecessor, as well as greatly reducing the clutter on the controls (you no longer need to press multiple buttons Simultaneously to initiate a special move). It does have its flaws: the game is rather short and can be beaten within 25 to 50 minutes, the visibility between enemies and obstacles can be hard to tell at times, as well as the lack of proper power-ups (as enemy chains only effect the score and rank). Nonetheless, Ikaruga is a fantastic title in its own right and if you're a fan of bullet hell games, or various Treasure games like Dynamite Headdy or Mischief Makers, this game is for you!

22200993.review:
"I will not die until I achieve something"

Y así ha sido. No me daré por vencido hasta que lo acabe. Una vez terminado con un crédito, puedo dar fe de la experiencia que me estaba perdiendo todos estos años, por terco, cabezón e ignorante. Un gazpacho de cabezonería que por fin he tenido a bien superar. Ikaruga es más que muchos Shmups, pero sin olvidar de dónde viene, permitiéndose el homenaje a sagas y compañías consagradas como Taito o Konami.

Treasure lanzó en 2001 un órdago imborrable del mapa, de estos juegos cuyo pistoletazo de salida no resuena, pero que que crean un eco que devuelve el sonido cada vez con más fuerza. Es una mezcla casi imposible entre Shoot 'em Up vertical clásico (a medio cuerpo de ser un maniac o danmaku), con esquemas clásicos: avance plataformero, combos estilo puzzle y una adictiva y endiablada jugabilidad, que castigará a cualquier ser humano que subestime el juego.

No estás listo para pasarte Ikaruga hasta que dominas su sistema de polaridad, que permite defendernos de balas y láseres del mismo color de nuestra nave, volviendo hostil el color contrario. O usas tus dos mitades del cerebro o estás muerto. Música con toques celtas increíbles, y como digo, un juego digno del recuerdo. Una vez lo dominas se convierte en una especie de metadona necesaria para engrasar nuestras neuronas, como una droga que ansiaremos. Cada partida te permite alcanzar nuevas zonas. La memoria es tu mejor aliado en este juego.

Excelencia que era incapaz de ver con mis ojos hasta que mis manos han venido a sustituir su función. Ver a través del mando empapándome de lo más puro: JUGAR.

22093707.review:
Ikarugua is a shooter hell game that was developedI by TREASURE, the same developer who made great classics like Gunstar Heroes, Guardian Heroes, Sin & Punishment, Radiant Silvergun, etc. This game was originally a Japan-exclusive game to the Arcades and the Dreamcast. It was released worldwide for the Nintendo Gamecube in 2003. This is game was also released to Xbox Live in 2011. then Steam port was released in February 18, 2014.

This game doesn't really feature power-ups, but it features a unique mechanic in exchange. This game allows you to change the prolarity of your ship to light and dark. If you chose the wrong polarity for the ship, you're basically screwed.

Ikarugua is really known for the challenge. Try playing it in hard mode, and you'll know why this game is seriously difficult. Ikarugua may be known for its difficulty, but it's also really addictive. The levels are really well-made and the music is really amazing in my opinion. The graphics are really good for this year. The Steam port of Ikarugua has gamepad support. I tested this game with a Xbox One controller, and it works pretty well. I'm not sure if this works with any gamepad other than a Xbox One controller, so can anyone please confirm it? The controls were very reponsive and stiff.

Just because this game is really good, that doesn't mean it has its flaws. One of the issues I have about this game is the story seems non-existent. The another issues is because of its difficulty, this game can possibly make someone throw a controller (or keyboard) to the wall. Ikaruga doesn't have many levels, and the levels are short if you mastered the game.

[h1] Pros	[/h1]
[list]
[*]Unique Design
[*]Amazing Soundtrack
[*]Very Addictive
[*]Challenging
[*]Extremely Fun
[*]Very Nice Gameplay
[*]Amazing Graphics
[*]Gamepad Support
[*]Responsive Controls
[/list]

[h1] Cons 	[/h1]
[list]
[*]Can take you a long time to beat the game
[*]I know added the difficulty as a pro, but it also can be a con to others
[*]Doesn't have many levels
[*]Levels are short if you mastered the game
[*]Non-existent Story
[/list]

I recommend you to buy this game. It's one of the best shooters (Not counting FPS) in steam.

[h1] Reviewer's Notes	[/h1]
This is my first review, so please give me some feedback. I have low hours in this game, but I encourage you to try this game.

EDIT 5/15/16: Fixed some of grammatical errors.

20901496.review:
Pros:
- Beautiful Visuals. The paint-like art style has definitely allowed this game to age better than its spiritual predecessor Radiant Silvergun.

- Incredible Music. Every tune is lovely to my ears.

- Easy to learn, insanely hard to master gameplay. It's rather incredible just how many challenges Treasure's designers managed to squeeze out of the incredibly simple mechanics at play here, and it's awesome to see all the creative enemy designs they were able to make with them as well.

- Satisfying as all hell. Seriously, those explosions. I have never felt quite so good when killing a troublesome boss.

Cons:
- A menu annoyances. To my knowledge, once you select a game mode, you can't back out if you clicked something you didn't mean to. Effectively, you have to play a game and kill yourself or reset the game to get back to the title screen.

- No real explanation of the story. There is a plot to this game, and it's not an excuse plot. I won't devote time to explaining it here, but I do think it's quite a shame that there's no signs of the story in this port (again, to my knowledge).

- Chaining. I admit, I have never been a fan of this part of Ikaruga. While it's certainly nowhere near as bad as it was in Radiant Silvergun (There, you had to chain to upgrade your weapons, which was *essential* to defeating later bosses), I still don't particularly like a scoring system that effectively forces you to memorize everything that happens in an entire stage to hit those elusive S++ ranks. Granted, I'm also terrible at chaining, so take that as you will.


Overall, Ikaruga has earned its reputation as being one of the greatest shoot-'em ups ever made. Fantastic level design, creative boss designs, good story (in the versions that actually have it), great visuals and music. What else could you ask for?

Before I go, though, one word of warning:

While far from the hardest game in this genre, Ikaruga is still difficult. Like, really, really, really difficult. Dark Souls doesn't come close.

If you're not up for that, I would advise you avoid this game.

19756524.review:
Disclaimer: I have hundreds of hours in this game via the original Dreamcast version, so my Steam hours aren't exactly representative of my play time.

All in all, this is probably the best shmup ever made. Exciting, fast paced, great mechanics, precise movement, true bullet hell. If you ever played and enjoyed any shootem up game back in the 8 bit days, you owe it to youself to try Ikaruga. I'm sure you won't be disappointed.

The difficulty is extreme, even on easy mode, which I can't bring myself to play (always normal mode because damn, hard mode is nearly impossible), but well worth your time to learn the patterns and slowly progress a little further on each run.

To be honest, I haven't felt a game was this difficult and as a result, so rewarding to get to the next level, since I was a kid playing Twin Cobra or Mario on the NES.

TL:DR - Get this game. Ikaruga is a harsh mistress, but will reward you in kind.

19500729.review:
“Wasted potential” comes to mind thinking about Ikaruga. A truly awesome mechanic that has never been used before wasted for a puzzle game.

The boss fights give a glimpse of what could have been, if Treasure had designed the game around survival play and surprise, surprise, they are the best parts of the game. (the first boss excluded, which is quite boring).

I simply can't be bothered to learn to chain since it's just not much fun. I tried it on the first stage, since it's quite easy there, but on stage 2 it's already way harder — and not just to properly chain while staying alive, but even more so to just figure out a route.

That really is the heart of Ikaruga: figuring out the best route to chain all the enemies and then of course also pull it off. I don't really care for that tough and especially not when I'm playing a shooting game.

Compared to other games with bad scoring systems like Dodonpachi, Ikaruga is way more designed around its scoring system — to such a point really that when you play for survival, the flow of the game (and the logic of the game world) is totally fucked up. There are long parts where all you do is change polarity every couple seconds and that's it. Enemies that don't even shoot at you are commonplace in Ikaruga, sections where you don't have to do almost anything in order to survive, plentiful.

Dodonpachi is at least still fun to play when you ignore scoring, Ikaruga is just depressing when you play it that way.

19121979.review:
Esse é o meu jogo de nave favorito!

A mecânica de troca de polaridade é genial e funciona assim: sua nave troca de cores, com a nave azul você absorve tiros azuis (não morre com eles e ainda enche seus mísseis) e dá o dobro de dano em naves vermelhas... e vice-versa, com a nave vermelha você não precisa se preocupar com os tiros vermelhos. O desafiador é ir mudando de polaridade ao mesmo tempo que enfrenta os inimigos e ameaças das fases que são bem difíceis

O jogo é bonito, a trilha sonora é empolgante, e o design é muito elegante. Não tem que pegar power-ups, sua nave já começa forte como deve ser - sem preocupar com morrer e voltar com o tiro fraquinho no final da fase!

O sistema de pontuação traz um elemento a mais para o jogo: ao matar um conjunto de 3 inimigos da mesma cor, você ganha um bônus para a pontuação. Mas as fases são projetadas para você conseguir manter esse bônus durante muito tempo, navegando pela fase de uma maneira bem artística.

Um espetáculo! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y5jeXQonsV4

18164651.review:
Originally released as an arcade game in 2001, Ikaruga garnered high praise from critics as the spiritual successor to Treasure's much-loved [i]Radiant Silvergun[/i] and quickly became one of the most popular bullet hell games of the decade. Witnessing a second and third release on the Sega Dreamcast and Nintendo GameCube in 2002 and 2003 respectively, the legendary Shmup was later introduced to the newer generation after its success lead to a fourth release on the XBLA in 2008.

While narrative clearly wasn't the main focal point of the game during the development phase, Ikaruga does feature an interesting backstory that gives appropriate context to the characters' actions. Tenro Horai; the leader of a small nation known as Horai; came across the Ubusunagami Okinokai or 'Power of the Gods', affording her powers surpassing that of any normal human being. With 'The Divine Ones' at her side, Tenro launched a campaign of global conquest. As the Horai felled each nation one by one, a small group of those brave enough to defy the Horai emerged, called the Tenkaku. Using advanced fighter aircraft known as 'Hitekkai', they fought a desperate battle against the Horai, but ultimately proved to be no match for their adversaries and suffered a swift and humiliating defeat. Once thought to have been among the many victims of the Horai's conquest, a young man called Shinra who had fought for the Tenkaku was shot down in an aerial battle high above the clouds. Dragged from the wreckage of his fighter and taken to the village of Ikaruga, Shinra was nursed back to health and entrusted by the village people with a powerful fighter unlike any other – the Ikaruga. Using the energies of two polarities, the Ikaruga was a versatile aircraft that could adapt to any given situation. With the power of the Ikaruga at his side, Shinra once again took to the skies to battle the Horai and bring about an end to their tyranny.

Ikaruga's most prominent feature; and indeed that which sets it apart from almost every other shmup to date; is its polarity system. Enemies appear in three varieties, each corresponding to one or both 'polarities'. White enemies fire white bullets towards the player, while black enemies discharge black bullets. Each boss typically utilizes both polarities and is capable of executing attacks using bullets of either. The Ikaruga itself however, is capable of switching between both polarities mid-flight, on the fly, thus introducing one of the game's most important mechanics – alternating polarities. While using the white polarity, the Ikaruga fires white bullets and is unaffected by those of that polarity fired by the enemy, though direct contact with black bullets is fatal. Any black enemies hit whilst using the white polarity also suffer significantly greater damage than what they would have suffered, had the black polarity been active. White bullets that draw near the Ikaruga are absorbed and converted into energy used to fuel a powerful homing missile attack. The reverse applies when using the black polarity. 

This clever mechanic encourages a 'risk versus reward' style of play that; together with the game's high level of difficulty; results in a very challenging but rewarding experience that makes Ikaruga one of Treasure's most enjoyable titles to play. The stage design itself is also particularly praiseworthy, both for its complexity and originality. While the first stage is quite easily manageable, every stage beyond it forces the player into a head-on confrontation with intricate mazes of bullets that require one to fully master the polarity switching mechanic in order to stand even the slightest chance of reaching the results screen. Skilled players can try to mix up their polarities by alternating on a regular basis to maximize the damage inflicted on the enemy, a tactic that becomes particularly viable when facing off against most of Ikaruga's bosses. Stage 3's boss stands out as being one of Ikaruga's trickier bosses that requires a more subtle approach from the player, involving the use of a number of advanced polarity switching techniques. 

Destroying three enemies of the same polarity consecutively results in a 'Chain', causing a substantial rise in the player's score. Each stage has been carefully designed in such a manner that it is possible for the very best players to complete a 'perfect' run of every stage by carrying a chain throughout the entire level, provided the enemies' attack patterns have been learnt well. 

Though the game features a steep learning curve that is likely to deter players who are new to games of the genre, Ikaruga offers a fantastic experience to anyone willing to take the time and effort to master the polarity switching mechanic.

Ikaruga's visuals are for the most part very impressive. The vast majority of finely-detailed enemies are well-animated. But what truly stands out is their unique design. Many of the enemies Ikaruga throws at the player look nothing like any enemies seen in other bullet helll games. The boss of the fourth stage is one prime example of the sheer creativity poured forth into the game. Each and every background also benefits from the same level of detail seen in the enemy design, with some of the game's mechanical backgrounds being among the most memorable for that reason. The lighting effects seen throughout the outdoor environments capture an atmosphere that makes every stage as breathtaking to look at as it is to play.

Ikaruga's powerful musical score plays a major role in contributing towards the creation of a different feel for each stage. While flights through enormous enemy facilities are accompanied by orchestral music with the subtle; yet highly effective; integration of techno music, massive aerial battles amidst amber-tinted skies are fought to the triumphant sounds of trumpets, capturing the intensity and desperation of the fight. Each boss' defeat is followed by a loud and catastrophic explosion that sounds just as impressive as it is to behold.

Ikaruga is the finest example of an innovative bullet hell game that is both a masterpiece in terms of its gameplay and art direction. Those who possess the time and dedication necessary to master Ikaruga and its original gameplay mechanics in order to experience the game to its fullest can expect to find themselves utterly absorbed by Treasure's iconic Shmup for a long time to come.

17900795.review:
Ikaruga is a harsh mistress. She is a love you cannot conquer, she is a complex beauty who demands perfection. Your best will never truly please her, she will make you feel inadequate at every moment, and yet you cannot stop trying to win her heart. When you are with her, any mistake you make will sting a thousand times worse. And she will make you furious, she will make you cry, she will drive you crazy, but you cannot stop loving her, because there is nothing else in the world that can compare to what she is.

Pros:
- She is perfection.

Cons:
- You are not.

Other thoughts:
- achievements are not broken down to different game play modes (easy/normal/hard/prototype mode). Also, Dot Eater is not linked to any level, you can get it in any mode.
- extra "double play" game modes not found in the console version.
- almost every combination of screen rotations are supported, which is great. It looks incredible on a pivot monitor.
- the game select at the start does not show the player character anymore (it uses the high score screen background instead)
- no training mode options to restart a level (you will need this a lot), or to start mid-level (GCN version had this I believe).
- to unlock a level on any difficulty, you just have to credit feed the game on easy mode. This also gets you the achievements for beating a boss. On the Dreamcast, you could only use training on levels you managed to reach with 1 credit, on the specific difficulty you reached it with.
- you cannot define analog axes as buttons, so on a non-xbox pad you may not be able to configure a trigger for the laser release. But the game supports just about any non-xinput pad other than this, which is great.
- when using level select to play the Final stage, the Stone-Like sequence is omitted! Boo!
- Downloaded replays tend to desync more often than not, what is up with that?
- tip: some levels are easier to get S++ score on with prototype mode.
- where's Radiant Silvergun?
